greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square of Narayana triangle A001263: View A001263 as a lower triangular matrix. Then the square of that matrix is also lower triangular. Sequence gives this lower triangle, read by rows.
comment: The first three columns are A000108 (the Catalan numbers), A002457 and A085374.
example: The first 3 rows are 1; 2, 1; 5, 6, 1; since the first 3 rows of the Narayana triangle in matrix format are M = [1 0 0 / 1 1 0 / 1 3 1]. Then M^2 = [1 0 0 / 2 1 0 / 5 6 1].
mathematica: t[n_, k_] = Sum[1/(i*k)*(Binomial[i-1, k-1]*Binomial[i, k-1]* Binomial[n-1, i-1]*Binomial[n, i-1]), {i, k, n}];
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jun 07 2004
ext: Edited and extended by _David Wasserman_, Sep 24 2004
